items.title: [PS4] Earth Defence Force 4.1 The Shadow of New Despair - Â£17.85 - Shopto
items.description:
The critics don't really rate it highly, but strangely enough, the gamers do.

Earth Defense Force 4.1: The Shadow of New Despair reaches new heights in its gigantic military vs kaiju gameplay on PlayStation 4! Huge monsters clash with squads of giant robots as bomb-mounted tanks and flying troops equipped with laser rifles shoot it out with alien bug armies in the streets! With the new heavily-amoured Fencer class, the action has never been bigger or more explosive! EDF! EDF! EDF!

Play as four unique classes, the Ranger, Wing Diver, Air Raider, and the new Fencer! 
The new Fencer class is a heavily-armoured juggernaut armed with a powerful melee weapon and shield and huge weapons like the mini gun! 
Fight through nearly 100 unique missions in single player, two player couch co-op, or four player online co-op! 
Utilise hundreds of different weapons, gadgets, and vehicles, from rifles and grenades, to giant mecha with rocket-powered fists! 
Call in huge airstrikes or command armoured vehicles like tanks and troop transport! 
Cities crumble to dust as massive kaiju battle gigantic mecha!

items.title: Evolve PC - Going Free to Play From July the 7th !!! 2K Games
items.description:
Studio co-founder Chris Aston made the announcement, revealing that the newly resurrected monster shooter will go into beta on July 7 (or July 8 in the southern hemisphere), allowing time to iron out bugs "over a period of weeks and months". Those who already own Evolve will get "Founder status" in the free-to-play version, with all owned content still accessible, and the promise of "gifts, rewards and special access" in the future. 

I was often tempted by the offers , but hey , glad I waited now , Evolve had some great reviews , but the over priced DLC killed the community spirit, people just lost interest , hopefully this will revive the game and the free to play model will breath new life into the Evolve gaming community .

There is also speculation that Evolve may go free to play on Xbox one and PS4.

items.title: [PS4] Devil May Cry: Definitive Edition - Â£7.50 - Tesco Direct
items.description:
New to DmC Devil May Cry: Definitive Edition, players will be able to play as DanteÃ¢â¬â¢s twin brother himself in VergilÃ¢â¬â¢s Bloody Palace Mode. For an extra depth of challenge, new modes have been added including Gods Must Die Mode, Must Style Mode and Hardcore Mode. In addition to the gameÃ¢â¬â¢s new features, players will also receive new Dante and Vergil costumes inspired by classic Devil May Cry character designs.

DmC sees the origin story of self-assured series protagonist Dante retold against a contemporary backdrop. The Dante of DmC is a young man who has no respect for authority or indeed society in general. Dante knows that he is not human, but also that he is not like the demons that have tormented him throughout his life. Caught between worlds, he feels like an outcast.

items.title: Looking to buy a new TV, any suggestions?
items.description:
Hi guys, I *think* I've finally convinced the missus to let me buy a new TV! Our Samsung is 5 years old and while it works perfectly fine, you know how it is when you want a new one!

I'm after something 4k for use with Tivo (hopefully 4k by the end of the year) and PS4.

I'd like something which has a decent (quick) smart features, so I can access youtube and netflix quickly.  It currently takes me about 5 minutes to load youtube on my samsung.

Nothing bigger than 50", ideally around the 40-43" mark.

My budget is between Â£500-Â£700

Any suggestions?

Cheers
